title: Oh look, the Darius skin is gemstone only
body: Another $15 skin artificially inflated to $200+. Good job, thanks for forcing RNG on people who just want to buy a piece of content for a character they like.

replies.body: As long as there's idiots without impulse control who ARE willing to spend 200$ to gamble for that skin, Riot will keep making hextech-exclusive skins. Don't blame Riot; blame those people.

It's not even right to blame Riot for making the idea.

Riot is just riding the gatchapon train that many prior companies (Valve, King, etc.) have proven to milk incredibly successfully. There's a reason even paid, full-release games such as Overwatch launch with loot boxes that give you content that should really be unlocked in-game only. Not through random box drops. 

Ironic that we used to scoff at 2.99 horse armor. Should have made it 7.99 and look more anime. Then people would pay for it hand-over-foot.
Gotta make back all that $$$ in free skins that they give away from crafting somehow, right?
I never found anything decent in the crafting system. So let's make a deal - no more crafting if there's no more overpriced/unobtainable skins.
How about I just blame both because both are required to participate for it to work out that way? =P {{summoner:14}}

Darius gets an exceptional non-comedy bad-ass skin and it's hidden behind Gemstones. Something most people deemed completely useless and pointless and just turn them into chests. I mean I didn't agree with Soulstealer Vayne being hidden behind the gemwall either, but at least she got Arclight a bit before it... and Annie has a thousand skins that amplify her theme in various ways.

I see a new Darius skin, that's not goofy(I like Dunkmaster, but c'mon it IS goofy). I think about time, I get to upgrade from Lord Darius/Woad Darius to another true Bad-ass skin.. Nope, guess not..  ugh..  I hate when they tie things into the convoluted hextech system

>I hate when they tie things into the convoluted hextech system

I hate when they tie things into the hextech system (Which is supposed to give out freebies), but still cost real money.
Example: The winter and project events.

**Project:** *"Pay real money to get RNG freebies! . . . That would probably be cheaper without the RNG. . ."*
(- -_- -)

**Snowdown:** *"We're going to replace seasonal discounts with RNG chests!"*
(o.O)

But otherwise, I have no issue with hextech crafting. Since I don't spend money. (>_>)
Well it had to be the plan from the start, I guess they can't just give loyal people stuff without making it part of the cash grab eventually.. :|

Shrug ive gotten 2 project skins for free so far.

Man than 0.00$ paywall is so hard to climb past.
The Project *event* gave 1 free chest. Then to get the skins *from the event*, you had to buy project chests for real money. Which defeats the stated purpose of the hextech system.

It's not 100% FREE.

You can get it in the following ways

acquire 10 rare gemstones  (gotten randomly from chests or bought during Gem Events)
unbox a shard of it
re-roll a permanent of it.

Yes you can get and open chests for free but the chance of finding the shard is very very very low.

So you can get it free, but it takes a very long time.
People shouldn't consider effort or time as free, as that is what money represents in the end anyway. It a note for easy traded for time and effort spent.

The fact that this many people are dumb enough to support Gemstone skins, arguably the greediest thing to ever come out of Riot, saddens me greatly.

"I can't outright buy it so it's a bad thing and people that are willing to spend that money on a game they enjoy are dumb."

The "dumb" people are the ones making it possible for you to play this game without paying a cent you cheap ass.
Like all the people on cruises who spend the entire trip barely conscious at the bar. They're not idiots - they're kind, generous souls who are paying for 80% of my cruise expenses for me!

No, it's quite simple: You're either dedicated enough to spend the money on it or you aren't. But stop complaining if you aren't.

I'd like to have a Lamborghini but I can't buy it because it's out of my league. Should I bitch about how those cars are too expensive?

Now imagine that instead of a Lamborghini, you're getting a mid-tier Acura.  For twice the price of a Lamborghini.

And this is why people bitch when 1350 skins are made into gemstone skins.

Do you have to buy the Acura?
Do you have to gamble your money on chests to get a Hextech skin?

Is someone physically forcing you to? No? Then stop complaining about a prestige item. Riot decides the prices, and if a skin would be sold for a million bucks someone would still buy it "because they can".

A better example even: You have an autograph from Ronaldo. To me it's a piece of worthless paper while you sell it for a 100 bucks.

It's unfair that a piece of paper someone wrote his name on is worth 100 bucks but if I do the same it's not. That's how you guys sound.

You sound incredibly selfish to sit there and call something done by Riot, who provides probably the world's most popular game for ***absolutely free***, as greedy. Everything that isn't the game itself costs money - all the extra aesthetic stuff. They even presented Hextech Crafting to offer ways to give that content away for free too - and here you are, accusing Riot of being greedy. Get a fucking clue dude. Don't be so entitled. Riot is a business, and if their game is free, they have to earn revenue *somewhere* to keep their employees paid. Even then, gemstone skins can be absolutely free - it only costs money if you're obsessively trying to buy them outright.
